question: How do I change the hostname on Arch Linux?

golden_answer.summary: Use 'hostnamectl set-hostname <name>' to change hostname persistently, which updates /etc/hostname and systemd.
steps: Set new hostname: sudo hostnamectl set-hostname <new-hostname>
Logout and login (or reboot) to see change in terminal prompt
validation: Terminal prompt shows new hostname after re-login
warnings: Hostname must follow rules: lowercase, alphanumeric, hyphens OK, no spaces
Don't use special characters or periods in hostname
Remember to update /etc/hosts - some applications check it
Change takes effect immediately but terminal prompt updates after re-login
Old method (editing /etc/hostname directly) still works but hostnamectl is preferred
